did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Organizational records, printed materials, photographs and architectural plans.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Alphabetical organizational and project files including files on the American Society of Landscape Architects, the Committee on West Side Improvement, the Long Island Park Commission, the 1939 New York World's Fair, and parks and schools in New York and New Jersey; articles and photographs and plans including plans for George Schurman.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Charles Nassau Lowrie was active in the City Beautiful movement and was one of the 11 founding members of the American Society of Landscape Architects in 1899. He was an 1891 graduate of Yale’s Sheffield Scientific School. He lived and worked in and around New York City and was a member of the Municipal Art Commission and a past president of the American Society of Landscape Architects (1910-12). In his professional work, he was in charge of landscaping Red Hook Housing Project in Brooklyn, did designs for public parks, and made preliminary plans for a Roosevelt Memorial. He was on the 1939 New York World's Fair staff. He was involved in city planning for Columbus, Ohio and the first master plan developed for Penn State University. He was the landscape architect for the Hudson County Park Commission for thirty years and designed several parks for the county's park system, including Lincoln Park and Pershing Field Memorial Park in Jersey City, the Stephen R. Gregg Hudson County Park in Bayonne, and Columbus Park in Hoboken.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Alphabetical organizational and project files including files on the American Society of Landscape Architects, the Committee on West Side Improvement, the Long Island Park Commission, the 1939 New York World's Fair, and parks and schools in New York and New Jersey; articles and photographs of Lowrie's projects; three large photographs of Roosevelt Memorial Park in Oyster Bay, N.Y.; and plans including plans for George Schurman, East Hampton, N.Y., 1916. Also, drawings of parks, academic campuses (including Cornell), residential landscapes, and graveyards.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York (N.Y.). Committee on West Side Improvement.
